values: During night live fire, RSO and safeties will use white light to clear each shooter as they move off the firing line.
-RSO and all safeties will be equipped with a white light.
RSO and Safeties

-Shooters will take instruction from the RSO and safeties as they make way to the firing line. -Saftey Brief
OIC, RSO, and Safeties
Rifle will remain stationary and unloaded in the firing position pointed down range and not brought with the soldier during the physical activity of the stressor.

-Saftey will ensure the firer places their unloaded rifle on the ground by the support before giving the green light to the tower. -The tower will not raise the targets until all safeties confirm their lane is ready.
-Lane Safeties -Tower -RSO
Soldiers will be kept out of kit and hydrated in a relaxed posture outside of the five-minute long lane.
-TLs and SLs will manage personnel who are not firing. -MEV will have necessary treatment capabilities in the event of a heat casualty.
-OIC and MEV team -SLs and TLs

draw.overall_supervision_plan: OIC and RSO will orient soldiers to the range and conduct a safety brief immediately following range occupation. Soldiers will coach/safety each other on the firing line with NCOs safetying in a 1:1 ratio. Newly Identified risks will be recorded and mitigated accordingly and risk acceptance will be improved at the appropriate level. Every Soldier will be considered a safety. If they see an unsafe act they will call a cease fire and notify everyone to stop training until the issue is resolved. OIC and RSO will continuously monitor all aspects of the Zero and Stress Range. Newly identified risks will be recorded and mitigated accordingly and risk acceptance will be approved at the appropriate level.
